title: Golden Visa Inquiries From US Citizens Soar After Trump Win
content: Affluent Americans are exploring golden visa programmes that allow foreign citizenship or residency through substantial investments.
summary: Affluent Americans are exploring golden visa programmes that allow foreign citizenship or residency through substantial investments.

title: Byju's Founder Accused Of Trying To Regain Firm With Hidden Cash
content: The founder of bankrupt Indian tech firm Byju's tried to use loan proceeds that he allegedly hid from US lenders to secretly buy back a software company that was taken over by an American trustee, according to a new court filing.
summary: The founder of bankrupt Indian tech firm Byju's tried to use loan proceeds that he allegedly hid from US lenders to secretly buy back a software company that was taken over by an American trustee, according to a new court filing.

title: US Teen Makes History, Becomes Youngest To Pass California Bar Exam
content: A 17-year-old prodigy has created history by becoming the youngest person to pass the California State Bar Exam, making her a practising lawyer in the state.
summary: A 17-year-old prodigy has created history by becoming the youngest person to pass the California State Bar Exam, making her a practising lawyer in the state.

title: Thai Woman Gets Death Sentence After Poisoning 14 Friends With Cyanide
content: Authorities have since linked Sararat to a series of cyanide poisonings dating back to 2015.
summary: Authorities have since linked Sararat to a series of cyanide poisonings dating back to 2015.

title: "Comedian", Banana Taped To A Wall, Sells For $6.2 Million In New York
content: A fresh banana taped to a wall -- a provocative work of conceptual art by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan -- was bought for $6.2 million on Wednesday by a cryptocurrency entrepreneur at a New York auction.
summary: A fresh banana taped to a wall -- a provocative work of conceptual art by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan -- was bought for $6.2 million on Wednesday by a cryptocurrency entrepreneur at a New York auction.

title: Video: Red Lava Pours Out As Volcano Erupts 7th Time In A Year In Iceland
content: A volcano erupted late Wednesday on the Reykjanes Peninsula in southwest Iceland, the national weather service said, the seventh since last December.
summary: A volcano erupted late Wednesday on the Reykjanes Peninsula in southwest Iceland, the national weather service said, the seventh since last December.

title: Bitcoin Hits New Record, Crosses $95,000
content: Bitcoin reached $95,004.50 in early Asian trade, with observers expecting it to soon reach $100,000.
summary: Bitcoin reached $95,004.50 in early Asian trade, with observers expecting it to soon reach $100,000.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai Dials Donald Trump, Elon Musk Joins The Call
content: When Google CEO Sundar Pichai dialed US-President elect Donald Trump, Elon Musk joined the call, according to a report.
summary: When Google CEO Sundar Pichai dialed US-President elect Donald Trump, Elon Musk joined the call, according to a report.

title: $30 Million Fine For Flouting Australia's Social Media Ban For Under 16
content: Social media companies could be fined more than US$30 million if they fail to keep children off their platforms, under new laws tabled before Australia's parliament Thursday.
summary: Social media companies could be fined more than US$30 million if they fail to keep children off their platforms, under new laws tabled before Australia's parliament Thursday.

title: India Slams Canada Report On Nijjar Murder Plot, Calls It "Ludicrous"
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said a Canadian report claiming Prime Minister Narendra Modi was aware of the plot to kill Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar was a "smear campaign".
summary: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said a Canadian report claiming Prime Minister Narendra Modi was aware of the plot to kill Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar was a "smear campaign".

title: Migrants Depart From Mexico Hoping To Reach US Before Trump Takes Office
content: Hundreds of migrants left the Mexican city of Tapachula on foot Wednesday, aiming to arrive at the US border before President-elect Donald Trump -- who has vowed massive deportations -- takes office in January.
summary: Hundreds of migrants left the Mexican city of Tapachula on foot Wednesday, aiming to arrive at the US border before President-elect Donald Trump -- who has vowed massive deportations -- takes office in January.

title: At $121 Million, Rare Painting Sets "World Record" For Surreal Work Of Art
content: A painting by the 'Master of Surrealism' Rene Magritte has smashed the auction record for any of his works by selling for an astonishing $121 million at a Christie's auction in New York on Tuesday.
summary: A painting by the 'Master of Surrealism' Rene Magritte has smashed the auction record for any of his works by selling for an astonishing $121 million at a Christie's auction in New York on Tuesday.

title: Biden Administration Moves To Forgive $4.7 Billion In US Loans To Ukraine
content: The Biden administration has moved to forgive about $4.7 billion in US loans to Ukraine, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said on Wednesday.
summary: The Biden administration has moved to forgive about $4.7 billion in US loans to Ukraine, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said on Wednesday.

title: UK Parliament Approves Bill To Renationalise Rail Services
content: Legislation put forward by the UK's new Labour government to renationalise the country's rail services, most of which are privately owned, was on Wednesday given the go-ahead by parliament.
summary: Legislation put forward by the UK's new Labour government to renationalise the country's rail services, most of which are privately owned, was on Wednesday given the go-ahead by parliament.

title: Xi Jinping Calls For Peace In Ukraine, Ceasefire In Gaza During Brazil Visit
content: Chinese leader Xi Jinping urged "more voices" to end the Ukraine war and a ceasefire in Gaza, as he conducted a state visit to Brazil's capital, Chinese state media said.
summary: Chinese leader Xi Jinping urged "more voices" to end the Ukraine war and a ceasefire in Gaza, as he conducted a state visit to Brazil's capital, Chinese state media said.

title: Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy Plan To Slash US Federal Spending And Regulation
content: Elon Musk outlined plans Wednesday for his new role as "efficiency" czar -- signaling an assault on federal spending and staffing that would be backed by President-elect Donald Trump's executive powers and a conservative Supreme Court.
summary: Elon Musk outlined plans Wednesday for his new role as "efficiency" czar -- signaling an assault on federal spending and staffing that would be backed by President-elect Donald Trump's executive powers and a conservative Supreme Court.

title: Hamas Says No Hostage-For-Prisoner Swap With Israel Unless Gaza War Ends
content: Hamas' acting Gaza chief Khalil al-Hayya said in an interview with Al-Aqsa TV released on Wednesday that there would be no hostages-for-prisoners swap deal with Israel unless the war in the Palestinian enclave ended.
summary: Hamas' acting Gaza chief Khalil al-Hayya said in an interview with Al-Aqsa TV released on Wednesday that there would be no hostages-for-prisoners swap deal with Israel unless the war in the Palestinian enclave ended.

title: India Slams Canadian Report On Nijjar Murder Plot, Calls It "Smear Campaign"
content: India on Wednesday strongly trashed as "smear campaign" a Canadian media report that claimed that the Indian prime minister was aware of the alleged plot to kill Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.
summary: India on Wednesday strongly trashed as "smear campaign" a Canadian media report that claimed that the Indian prime minister was aware of the alleged plot to kill Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

title: As Automaker Jaguar Rebrands Itself With New Logo, Netizens Unimpressed
content: Prior to its relaunch as an electric-only brand, luxury car manufacturer Jaguar announced its 'new era ' by unveiling its new logo and branding.
summary: Prior to its relaunch as an electric-only brand, luxury car manufacturer Jaguar announced its 'new era ' by unveiling its new logo and branding.

title: Google Told Employees To Destroy Messages To Avoid Antitrust Suits: Report
content: Even as Google, the internet giant, stored the world's information, it kept a lid on its internal communications - telling employees to destroy messages, to not use certain words - to avoid antitrust suits, claimed a report.
summary: Even as Google, the internet giant, stored the world's information, it kept a lid on its internal communications - telling employees to destroy messages, to not use certain words - to avoid antitrust suits, claimed a report.
